title: LR circuit - time constant with two resistors

content.question: The circuit shown in the figure consists of a battery of <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> <math alttext="open E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>∆ê</mi></math>, an inductor of inductance <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math>, an open switch, and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> resistors of resistance <math alttext="R sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="R sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. When the switch is closed, which of the following is a correct equation for the time constant of the circuit?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator L, and denominator R sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>L</mi><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction with numerator L, and denominator R sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>L</mi><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator L, and denominator R sub 1 plus R sub 2, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>L</mi><mrow><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator L times open parenthesis, R sub 1 plus R sub 2, close parenthesis, and denominator R sub 1, end sub, times R sub 2, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>L</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator L times open parenthesis, R sub 1 plus R sub 2, close parenthesis, and denominator R sub 1, end sub, times R sub 2, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>L</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 13.5: Circuits with Resistors and Inductors (LR Circuits)

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
